question: Which orbital will have lower energy if two orbitals have the same value of (n+l)?
option1: orbital with lower value of n
option2: orbital with lower value of l
answer: orbital with lower value of n
explanation: If two orbitals have the same value of (n+l) then orbital with lower value of n will have lower energy. Also, energies of the orbitals in the same subshell decrease with increase in atomic number.
